title: Publisher Rocket Tutorial: Step-by-Step Amazon KDP Research Tutorial | Sell more books on Amazon

tactics.name: Keyword Research with Publisher Rocket
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to analyze keyword performance, competitors, and market trends for Amazon KDP books.
steps: Review data on average pages, competitors, average price, and estimated monthly earnings
Filter keywords based on market demand and competition
caveats: Keyword data changes frequently; avoid rigid strategies
source_quotes: You need to remember that Amazon actually has like rules for their keywords...
Estimated Amazon searches per month is the most important thing

tactics.name: Evaluate Keyword Competition
tactics.description: Assess keyword viability using Publisher Rocket's competitive score and competitor count metrics
steps: Check estimated Amazon searches per month
Analyze competitor count and color-coded competitive score (red = high competition)
Compare against thresholds for actionable insights
caveats: Avoid keywords with red competitive score and high competitor count
source_quotes: this keyword is like so competitive for you I think this is done based on the distribution of this and this

tactics.name: category_analysis
tactics.description: Identify high-ranking categories for keyword relevance
caveats: Categories may not align with target audience
source_quotes: the most important thing for me in this list is actually this the categories

heuristics.name: Competitor-Search Balance
heuristics.condition: If competitors exceed 5000 and estimated searches are below 100, avoid keyword
source_quotes: If you have like okay let's imagine a scenario where there's um 5000 competitors... it would be ridiculous to like join Dallas and complete cell

heuristics.name: Penalize High Competition Keywords
heuristics.condition: If competitor count exceeds 3000 and search volume below 1000, penalize keyword viability
source_quotes: this keyword is not worth it because it's 1176 sheet number of searches and 24 191 books as ah Computing for this keyword

heuristics.name: low_review_boost
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize
source_quotes: if the book description does not work for them they'll leave

heuristics.name: Review Count Threshold
heuristics.condition: If median_reviews is below 200, prioritize niches with lower competition
source_quotes: If you want to do ads...at least five books out

claims.statement: Amazon prohibits using program names (e.g., 'Kindle Unlimited') in keyword boxes
source_quotes: You can't use keywords like this with your books because Amazon doesn't allow you to put program names in your keyword boxes

claims.statement: Average pages of top-ranking books are not a reliable metric for formatting decisions
source_quotes: It's not even really reliable like that... I wouldn't do that because this is just a keyword

claims.statement: High competitor count keywords are less likely to achieve top rankings on Amazon
source_quotes: this is like so competitive for you I think this is done based on the distribution of this and this

claims.statement: Categories influence book visibility and audience targeting
source_quotes: we don't want to be in the wrong category

claims.statement: Some authors derive 80-90% of their income from KDP
source_quotes: I make around 80 of my income...

niche_patterns.description: Target specific niches with clear identity, problem, and constraint parameters
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Narrower niches often have lower competition and higher search intent
source_quotes: You need to remember that Amazon actually has like rules for their keywords...

niche_patterns.description: Combine niche with seasonal demand to capture temporary search spikes
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Seasonal keywords can have high search volume during specific periods
source_quotes: this will be very competitive especially during this period because it's November
